meanings.definition: The quality of being straightforward and honest in communication or action.
meanings.sent1: Her directness in expressing her feelings made it easy to understand her.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate the directness of his feedback; it helps me improve.
meanings.sent3: His directness in asking for more cake was both surprising and amusing.
meanings.sent4: The directness of the sunlight through the window was blinding.
meanings.sent5: The directness of the teacher's instructions left no room for confusion.

meanings.definition: The act of guiding or supervising something.
meanings.sent1: The directness of the coach helped the team achieve victory.
meanings.sent2: She showed great directness in managing the project efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The directness of the cat herding competition was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The directness of the compass needle always points north.
meanings.sent5: The directness of the traffic officer kept the cars moving smoothly.

meanings.definition: The shortest distance between two points.
meanings.sent1: The directness of the path through the forest saved us time.
meanings.sent2: He calculated the directness of the route to reach the destination faster.
meanings.sent3: The directness of the bee's flight to the flower was impressive.
meanings.sent4: The directness of the laser beam cut through the metal effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The directness of the arrow's flight towards the target was flawless.
